title: For Sale/Trade:  Bushmaster BA50 Shooting System
postcontent:
This is a complete long distance shooting system, not just the rifle.  To put this kit together would normally be difficult – unfortunately to put this together now would be almost insurmountable.  This is your opportunity if you have ever wanted a comprehensive set like this then count your pennies, sell your wife’s Beanie Baby collection, or ask yourself “Do both kids really need to go to college?”  

Most think of Barretts when they think of precision .50 caliber rifles.  The Bushmaster BA50 is actually more accurate.  The BA50 is a bolt action rifle which forms a better seal / even venting of gas and thus a more accurate round hurtling down range than a semi-automatic Barrett*.  

The BA50 is a 1 moa rifle – this isn’t common in 50's.  Thanks to Hollywood many believe all .50 calibers are used for surgical shooting.  Most multiple round .50's are good for distance and power but struggle getting close to 1 MOA.  

The March 2012 issue of Tactical Weapons has an article called "Battle of the .50 BMGs" which does a head-to-head comparison between the Bushmaster and the Barrett with the Bushmaster winning top marks.  Here is the website with that article:  

http://www.tactical-life.com/online/tactical-weapons/battle-of-the-50-bmgs/

The December 2009 issue of Special Weapons magazine also had a great – and positive – review of the Bushmaster BA50 that is worth reading.  

The kit I am selling consists of:  

Bushmaster BA50 rifle 
Leupold Mark 4 LR/T m1 (8.5 – 25x).  Specifically built as a top end .50 caliber rifle scope.  
BORS unit (Barrett Optical Ranging System) and software.  Basically a computer for the scope that allows you to enter ballistic data and range to the target, it then adjusts your point of aim for you.  This accounts for everything but wind value.   
Leupold ARD (anti-reflective device) 
Leupold magnetic covers 
Custom monopod
Custom cheek rest 
Barrett carry handle.  Mounted at the center point of weight (with the muzzle break) to allow for easier moving of the rifle.   
Barrett exRings (15 – 40 moa) 
Two 10-round magazines
Sentry Solutions treatment.  This makes for easier cleaning and added protection for the rifle.  
Leica 1200 laser range finder.  Again, nothing but the best, this provides some of the data for the BORS unit.   
Wind wizard handheld wind meter.  This provides wind data for the final calculation of those long distance shots.  
OTIS Barrett combat cleaning kit 
Big ol’ .50 cleaning rod 

Also includes the following complete ammo:

660 grain Federal full metal jacket rounds (x100)
PMC full metal jacket (x10)
Standard ball rounds (x33)
Tracer rounds (x5)
Incendiary rounds (x7)
APIT – Armor Piercing Incendiary Tracer rounds (x8)
Frangible (aka: Fragmented) rounds (x11) 
Hornady A-Max 750-grain rounds (x50)

10 snap caps for practicing trigger squeeze indoors without having to explain to the wife… and neighboring six houses… the new ventilation in their walls  :)

Both the muzzle break and the case have a custom image of skull and crossbones with a bullet hole through the skull.  This might be a good time to ask yourself how this set could get any cooler.  

The first two photos below were taken by the gentleman I bought the rifle from.  The third image is from a day at the range with a buddy... It was a good day.  If you need more images I can take them, but they will be from my cell phone and may not be quite as nice.  Here is a website with additional images and information about this specific rifle.  

http://barrettrifles.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=43&t=1946

I can provide more information about the items listed above, but honestly if you have to ask this may not be the right system for you.  

I will need the buyer to sign a transfer slip and I will also need to see a permit to purchase or conceal carry permit.  

Reasonable trades toward this kit I would consider are: M1A1 / SOCOM16; M-14; High end AR (5.45 or 5.56 or .308); High end AK (in 5.45 or 5.56 or 7.62); Top of the line 1911’s; Camping / cabin land accessible to water; recreational items such as a boat with a cuddy cabin or Class C motor home; I'm fairly open to trades as long as the items are well taken care of and the weapons are in a common caliber.  

I will read and reply to all serious offers but I am not in a hurry to sell.  When this is gone I won’t be able to replace it.  I may hold off on moderate offers to see what else is out there.    

Update: This system is currently available for viewing and for running a slightly quivering hand down it, at Atomic Tactical in Bloomington.  

Summary: for sale is one bad a** complete shooting system that comes with everything but the spotter calling out range and wind value… Of course with a package this magnificent there shouldn’t be a shortage of people wanting to be your spotter. 

*To be clear, Barrett rifles are amazing performers, legendary, and deserving of much praise.  They have been battle tested and that's a thing to be respected... No sense starting something with the Barrett followers out there.
